To make them in other fluids, try a sealed tank with equal volumes of helium and sulfur hexafluoride. Helium is 1/6th the mass of air, and sulfur hexafluoride is six times the mass of air. So a gas equivalent of air/water junction. Some vapour from liquid nitrogen could be included as the “smoke” as it’s density will be between the helium and sulfur hexafluoride. Use some kind of plate plunger the same was as you did in the pool, and a half vortex ring of nitrogen vapour likely will form in the sulfur hexafluoride, and end at the thin layer of vapour between the two other gasses. It would look like a white mist has life and a mind of it’s own, as the other two gasses will be invisible.

i am surprised she didn't notice the force lines they share at the surface. I suspected they share a funnel. make sure when you do this experiment, such as a tub, you fill it with enough water. usually to the top is good enough. when you use a single paddle to make the vortices, you will notice a particle and anti particle relationship. The closer they are to each other, part of their energy will transfer in both energy waves broadcasted from them, as well as force lines. if they combine they will explode, forming smaller node and anti-node vorts. If the slow down enough, the same thing occurs except at a smaller fraction than from annihilation. if you use 2 paddles, you will create 2 of the same node, and therefore it will demonstrate repelling force lines in the middle. I used this experiment a possible correlation to electro-magnetic forces as well as a possible model for sub-atomic particle formation. Most of the predictions and formulas generated from observing the interactions in the pool are mirrored to quantum-mechanics. These experiments led me to conclude that if particle act as they do in the pool experiment, then a "stable" particle, which would be a full ring that has spin ( magnetic moment) would be the shape of a donut-toroid. The most stable of particles being an electron, where it exists in two distant points at the same time. 20 years after that prediction, the first image of an electron was identical in description. Although it was not mentioned in the video, this appears to be an excellent analogy for a non-local realistic explanation of quantum entanglement.   Each vortex corresponds to a correlated quantity such as electron spin or light polarization that were created by the same event occurring in the past.  When one vortex spins one way the other necessarily spins the other way as a geometrical constraint.  Similarly correlated quantum properties always have opposite angular momentum (spin or polarization). Interact with (measure) one of the vortexes and the other vortex is affected through the subsurface part of the vortex, as must be the case for the water vortexes.  The invisible instantaneous connection between the particles in the quantum model being a mini wormhole.

I did this in the bathtub the other day, and immediately thought "black hole", especially with the border conditions forcing inflation of the space between the two black spots. But this video just gave me a great idea. "It's not a wave, it's cooler than a wave! ... Try this at home... try it next to the wall." Instead, what if the wall of the pool WASN'T a wall, but an artificial border, similar to the one set up in the double slit experiment? Does the vortex go through one slit as a vortex, and the other as a wave, maintaining the vortex on both sides of the "wall" and creating a real life explanation for the "spooky action at a distance" of quantum mechanics, revealing Einstein's "hidden variables?" While it's easy to break all of this down into fluid dynamics, my interest in it isn't so much the motion of the fluid, but the understanding that the shadow we visualize on the surface at the bottom of the pool is a glowing black spot, which has absolutely nothing to do with the surface of the pool, but at the (seemingly) invisible surface of the water, in the context of reality and the cosmos, which acts as a flat surface.... If the black hole has real implications, then it supports the idea of the entire universe being projected onto a 2D surface.

Motion never ends in fluid and the vortexes formed visually illustrate it. Fluid stillness or fluid-kinetic-neutral is not possible as the molecules are constantly rolling around each other on an endless journey. There is no such thing as non-moving fluid water. In a pool the water will always stay in motion in all directions, it doesn't matter how still it looks. The circles are indicators of a locally coherent force vector propagating through a strata of perpetually jostling molecules.

To get a full vortex ring in the water, simply submerge and move the whole plate. You don't want your arm to interfere with the ring, so use string to pull the plate.  If using a glass plate, then tie a net behind the plate, so that you have 4 strings in front forming a pyramid, then pull the apex of the pyramid.  Like this:   |>----  where | is plate and >---- is the string.  If you use a plastic plate, you can drill 4 holes around the perimeter, insert string into each, tie knots bigger than holes, and pull all 4 strings together.
